title: Iris Recognition: Traditional vs. Deep Learning Approaches
description: Comparison of traditional biometric pipeline vs deep learning-based methods
content:
## Iris Recognition: Traditional vs. Deep Learning Approaches

[Alessio Pannozzo](https://www.linkedin.com/in/alessio-pannozzo-7a9101176/), [Lorenzo Spataro](https://www.linkedin.com/in/lorenzo-spataro-b0690117a/)  and me are excited to share our latest project comparing traditional biometric pipelines and deep learning-based methods for iris recognition! 👁️💡  

Using the OpenIris library, we implemented a classic approach leveraging Gabor filters for feature extraction and Hamming distance for matching. In contrast, our deep learning model, based on ResNet-50, automatically learns feature embeddings and evaluates similarity.  

📊 Key Takeaways:  

✅ Traditional methods excel in structured environments with well-defined features.  
✅ Deep learning provides greater adaptability to complex patterns and variations.  
✅ Our evaluation on the CASIA-Iris-Thousand dataset highlights the strengths and trade-offs of each approach.  

This study provides insights into choosing the right approach for real-world biometric authentication systems. 🚀  
Would love to hear your thoughts on the future of AI-powered biometrics!

title: Pneumonia detection from Chest X-ray images
description: Comparison of binary classification techniques using traditional methods and deep learning
content:
## Pneumonia detection from Chest X-ray images
[Marco Realacci](https://www.linkedin.com/in/marco-realacci-634433264/),  [Lorenzo Spataro](https://www.linkedin.com/in/lorenzo-spataro-b0690117a/), [Alessio Pannozzo](https://www.linkedin.com/in/alessio-pannozzo-7a9101176/),  [Gioele Maria Zoccoli](https://www.linkedin.com/in/gioele-maria-zoccoli-146299302/)  and me are excited to present our latest project comparing traditional machine learning and deep learning methods for pneumonia detection from chest X-ray images! 🏥📊

We evaluated classical models like Logistic Regression, KNN, Decision Trees, and SVM alongside deep learning architectures, including CNNs and ResNet50. A key focus of our study was cross-dataset generalization—analyzing how well models trained on one dataset perform on unseen data. Using the Chest X-Ray Images (Pneumonia), CheXpert, and RSNA Pneumonia Detection Challenge datasets, we tested model robustness in real-world scenarios.  

🔍 Key Takeaways:  

✅ Traditional methods show stability across datasets but struggle with complex patterns.  
✅ Deep learning models, especially ResNet50, achieve higher accuracy but are sensitive to dataset variability.  
✅ Fine-tuning classification thresholds improves diagnostic performance.  
Our findings offer valuable insights into selecting the best approach for AI-assisted pneumonia detection in clinical applications. Excited to hear your thoughts on the future of medical AI! 🚀
